description.narrative: The UNDP Accelerator Labs are a new service offering that works with people, governments, and the private sector to reimagine development for the 21st century.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Output 1: UNDP Country Offices and partners will have increased capability for scanning, sensemaking and experimentation for sustainable development solutions in 60 developing countries.
1.1 Number of new data sources used at Country Office level. 1.2 Diversity of different data sources used. 1.3 Number of sustainable development solutions identified and documented. 1.4 Variety of innovation methods used to test and iterate over the different hypotheses.
Output 2: New sustainable development solutions will be scaled at country level as part of UNDP’s country programme and operations, national policy and/or local markets.
2.1 Learning the Accelerator Lab Network shares with a public audience (outside of UNDP). 2.2 Number of lab insights, processes or products which are taken up by governments or other partners. 2.3 Proportion of partners and governments that increase their take up of the innovation methods included in the Accelerator Lab Network suite. 2.4 Proportion of UNDP Country Office programming influenced by the Accelerator Lab Network’s work and methodologies.
Output 3: A core global level result will be that a global learning and scaling network is established and functioning.
3.1 Size and density of the network effects among the Accelerator Labs. 3.2 Number of new models, approaches, and insights documented and disseminated throughout the network. 3.3 Engagement of the broader Development ecosystem with published learnings from the Accelerator Lab Network. 3.4 Amount of influence the learnings and methods of the Accelerator Lab Networks have on the discourse of the broader Development ecosystem.

comment.narrative:
Output 1: UNDP Country Offices and partners will have increased capability for scanning, sensemaking and experimentation for sustainable development solutions in 60 developing countries.
1.1 5 new data sources per year. 1.2 6 different type of data sources per year. 1.3 35 new potential solutions per lab per year. 1.4 5 innovation methods per Action Plan.
Output 2: New sustainable development solutions will be scaled at country level as part of UNDP’s country programme and operations, national policy and/or local markets.
2.1 At least 6 blogs or other (substantial) media posts published per year. 2.2 At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. 2.3 At least one government entity or partner has adopted an accelerator lab method. 2.4 At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects.
Output 3: A core global level result will be that a global learning and scaling network is established and functioning.
3.1 The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network. 48 interaction per year. 3.2 25% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. 3.3 The Accelerator Lab Networks work is featured at least 3 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account. 3.4 Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media. Identify and engage with 5 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.

-Identifying 20 solutions to waste management challenges and building a partnership with the National Agency of Waste . -60 projects across Algeria in response to the challenges created by the covid-19 on various topics such as health, economics, education, and so on were identified. -Organising one virtual hackathon to respond to Covid-19 in partnership with the Algeria Startup challenge program and an incubator. -Blogging and communicating on social media posts our achievements. -Experiment 05 solutions in response to Covid-19. -03 solutions embedded in communities, policies and programing. -Positioning in the Algerian entrepreneurial ecosystem and being part of the Algerian network of Accelerators and incubators. -Implementation of Youth leadership program.

Output 1: UNDP Country Offices and partners will have increased capability for scanning, sensemaking and experimentation for sustainable development solutions in 60 developing countries.
1.1 2 new sources of data per year. 1.2 3 different type of data sources per year. 1.3 20 new potential solutions per lab per year. 1.4 2 innovation methods per Action Plan.
Output 2: New sustainable development solutions will be scaled at country level as part of UNDP’s country programme and operations, national policy and/or local markets.
2.1 3 blogs, or other (substantial) media posts published per year. 2.2 At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. 2.3 At least one government entity or partner has learned about Accelerator lab methods. 2.4 At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects.
Output 3: A core global level result will be that a global learning and scaling network is established and functioning.
3.1 The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network. 48 interaction per year. 3.2 5% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. 3.3 The Accelerator Lab Network´s work is featured at least 2 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account. 3.4 Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media. Identify and engage with 2 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.

-Policy frontier developed and presented (Amman) -03 Heads of accelerator labs recruited -Participation in Bootcamp (Quito) with 02 heads of AccLabs -Identified the first learning circle area ( waste management).

Output 3: A core global level result will be that a global learning and scaling network is established and functioning.

Output 1: UNDP Country Offices and partners will have increased capability for scanning, sensemaking and experimentation for sustainable development solutions in 60 developing countries.
1.1.1 Computer-assisted surveys (COVID-19 socio-economic impact assessment on households and enterprises) final reports (with Governance portfolio) 1.1.2 Training of 10 CNESE officials on Geospatial Information System (with GIS support team and Governance portfolio) 1.1.3 Sensemaking and collective intelligence conference on renewable energy (Innovation days 2021) (with Nature, Climate, Energy portfolio) 1.3.1 Ten solutions have been identified, documented and are being experimented thru PROCESS Bootcamp. 1.4.1 Solutions Mapping Strategy has been developed and is being used by other accelerator labs. 1.4.2 4 Experimental strategies have been developed, shared and implemented by the country office.
Output 2 : New sustainable development solutions will be scaled at country level as part of UNDP’s country programme and operations, national policy and/or local markets.
1.1.1 A blog on learnings of South Korean and Chinese experiences on the COVID-19 for Algeria 1.1.2 A blog on the use of collective intelligence with a diversity of actors (government, academia, private sector, civil society) on renewable energy 1.1.3 A blog about how we create champions! a journey of a change maker at the accelerator Lab algeria. 2.2.1 A partnership with the National Agency of Waste and the private sector to implement and run our experimentation. 2.3.1 Method and critaria of experimentation has been hosted by the private sector. 2.4.1 4 Experimental methods have been developed, shared and implemented by the country office.
Output 3: A core global level result will be that a global learning and scaling network is established and functioning.
3.1 Solution Mapper is interacting on regular basis with the Global Network via Teams and WhatsApp group. 3.2 The experimenter is interacting and launching initiatives with the global Network via the different platforms of communication. 3.3 Explorer proposed the development of a global Acc Lab library of tools and participated in a working group led by Acc Lab Ukraine Explorer
